title: Why is Karlheinz Stockhausen so famous - what did he contribute to music, and are there composers who dismiss him? - Quora

response.answer_text: Stockhausen’s main claim to fame outside of academic circles is his use of tape editing and manipulation as a means of composing new music from scratch. We take it for granted now that recorded music can be raw material for creativity—that idea is the basis of hip-hop and many forms of electronic music. Stockhausen did not influence much of that music directly (he was totally contemptuous of popular music) but he did influence some iconic musicians. He inspired the Beatles to try tape manipulation, and in return, they put him on the cover of Sgt Pepper’s Lonely Hearts Club Band.  Miles Davis cited Stockhausen as his inspiration for albums like Bitches Brew and In A Silent Way, which he created by recording open-ended improvisation and then editing them into shape. As significant as he is, Stockhausen’s technological innovations are more widely admired than his actual music. Outside of academic and avant-garde circles, most people (myself included) find that his music ranges from difficult to unbearable. The idea that music needs to be difficult for the sake of being difficult has not aged well, and is mercifully falling out of fashion.

The fact that he utilized his infatuation with writing his pieces orchestral with electronics and dissonance was brilliant and one of the first, John Cage another. He used tape cuts and looping and usage of the VCA Arp 2600. An inspiration to some pop artists and those who have never heard of him
